identificationModule.briefTitle: The Effect of Synaquell™ in Contact Sport Athletes
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effect of Synaquell™ on Objective Measures of Brain Health in Male and Female Youth Contact Sport Athletes

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This research is being done to investigate the dietary supplement, Synaquell (TM), for effects on brain function in youth contact sport athletes.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This randomized clinical trial will compare a brain health supplement (Synaquell) with placebo in both male and female ice hockey players over the course of an entire season. The repeated measure design will compare pre- and post-season objective brain health parameters, including quantitated EEG (Neurocatch), blood \& saliva biomarkers, impact monitoring mouthguard, and a rapid number naming test (King Devick).

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The study staff responsible for distributing SynaquellTM will not be blinded to the intervention, but all subjects and other study staff will be blinded.

armGroups.label: Experimental: Synaquell Male Group
armGroups.description: Male youth hockey players will receive the dietary supplement Synaquell, twice-daily during the hockey season. Due to difference in game rules and playing styles, males and females will be treated as two separate arms of the research protocol.

armGroups.label: Placebo Comparator: Placebo Male Group
armGroups.description: Male youth hockey players will receive the placebo twice-daily, during the hockey season. Due to difference in game rules and playing styles, males and females will be treated as two separate arms of the research protocol.

armGroups.label: Experimental: Synaquell Female Group
armGroups.description: Female youth hockey players will receive the dietary supplement Synaquell, twice-daily during the hockey season. Due to difference in game rules and playing styles, males and females will be treated as two separate arms of the research protocol.

armGroups.label: Placebo Comparator: Placebo Female Group
armGroups.description: Female youth hockey players will receive the placebo twice-daily, during the hockey season. Due to difference in game rules and playing styles, males and females will be treated as two separate arms of the research protocol.

interventions.name: Synaquell(TM)
interventions.description: 7.9 grams (1 scoop) of Synaquell powder mixed with 12 ounces of water two times per day for the duration of the sport season. The daily amount taken by each participant is (15.8 grams).

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: 7.9 grams (1 scoop) of placebo powder mixed with 12 ounces of water two times per day for the duration of the sport season. The daily amount taken by each participant is (15.8 grams). The placebo looks, smells, and tastes like Synaquell but does not contain active ingredient.

primaryOutcomes.description: Obtained by EEG recording of N100 potential amplitude. This measures is subsequently linearly transformed to a standardized score on a 0-100 scale, with larger peak amplitudes and shorter peak latencies resulting in higher scores. Changes in brain vital sign scores are depicted within a radar plot format, with the transformation process preserving the essential ERP results but enabling practical, simplified interpretation.

Obtained by EEG recording of N100 potential latency. Increased latencies are indicative of slower responses. Obtained by EEG recording of N100 potential amplitude. Changes in brain vital sign scores are depicted within a radar plot format, with the transformation process preserving the essential ERP results but enabling practical, simplified interpretation.

Changes in brain vital sign scores are depicted within a radar plot format, with the transformation process preserving the essential ERP results but enabling practical, simplified interpretation.

Blood will be at a biomarker level. We will investigate the biomarker neurofilament light (NfL). BDNF. The biomarker will be measured in Nanograms per Milliliter (ng/ml).
Blood will be at a biomarker level and B-Synuclein will be investigated. The biomarker will be measured in Nanograms per Milliliter (ng/ml).
Blood will be at a biomarker level and Von Willebrand Factor (vWF) will be investigated. The biomarker will be measured in Nanograms per Milliliter (ng/ml).
Blood will be at a biomarker level and A-Synuclein (SNCA) will be investigated. The biomarker will be measured in Nanograms per Milliliter (ng/ml).
Blood will be at a biomarker level and Brain Derived Neurotrophic Factor (BDNF) will be investigated. The biomarker will be measured in Nanograms per Milliliter (ng/ml).

secondaryOutcomes.description: A rapid number-naming test that requires individuals to read 3 numbered patters aloud as fast as possible, the resulting time if the KDT score. The post-season score is compared to the pre-season baseline. An increase in the number of seconds required to read the 3 number patterns is considered to be significant.
The Impact monitor mouthguard measures head acceleration.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Beginning of practice to last game (approximately 6 months).

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Impact monitor mouthguard measures rotation of the head.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Beginning of practice to last game (approximately 6 months).

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Impact monitor mouthguard measures the number of head impacts.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Beginning of practice to last game (approximately 6 months).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Fluent English Speakers
* Medically cleared to play contact sport

Exclusion Criteria:

* An allergy to the ingredients of Synaquell™ or the placebo (ingredients listed on page
* Clinically documented hearing issues,
* In-ear hearing aid or cochlear implant
* Implanted pacemaker or defibrillator
* Metal or plastic implants in skull
* Lack of verbal fluency in the English language
* History of seizures
* Allergy to rubbing alcohol or EEG gel
* Pregnancy
